Yes, there are many Abbesses and Priests today who are making a difference in the world. Here are a few examples: 

Abbesses:
- Mother Teresa Christe, an American nun and Abbess who founded the Contemplative Sisters of the Good Shepherd, a contemplative monastery in South Carolina that supports the homeless and disenfranchised through various social services.
- Sister Wendy Beckett, a British Carmelite nun and art historian who became a popular television presenter, promoting art appreciation around the world.
- Abbess Tenzin Palmo, a British nun who spent 12 years living in a cave in the Himalayas and is now the Abbess of the Dongyu Gatsal Ling Nunnery in India, promoting gender equality and female monastic education in Tibetan Buddhism.

Priests:
- Father Patrick Desbois, a French Catholic priest who conducts research and campaigns against anti-Semitism and genocide, particularly related to the Holocaust.
- Father Gustavo Gutiérrez, a Peruvian priest who developed liberation theology, which combines Christian theology with social and political concerns in order to promote social justice and reduce poverty.
- Father James Martin, an American Jesuit priest who is a writer and speaker on social justice issues, including LGBT rights and spirituality.

These are just a few examples of modern-day religious leaders who are making a significant impact in the world today.
